titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1401) to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2000 and 2001 for military activities of the Department of Defense, to prescribe military personnel strengths for fiscal years 2000 to 2001, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-166, by Mrs. Myrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1401 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order the Committee on Armed Services amendment in the nature of a substitute now printed in the bill, modified by the amendment printed in Part A of H. Rept. 106-166. Waives all points of order against the amendment. Provides for an additional 1 hour of general debate at the beginning of the 2nd legislative day of consideration. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. Only amendments printed in H. Rept. 106-166 are in order. Amendments, except as otherwise specified, will be considered in the order listed, offered only by a Member designated, be debatable for 10 minutes equally divided and shall not be subject to amendment. Authorizes the Cha...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 64.

action.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 200, H. Res. 195 is laid on the table.

bill.summary: 5/26/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 1401 (defense authorization).
